additional.manualNote: Characteristics are not contractual and can be modified without prior notice and without an obligation to update. Document may list equipment/subjects not concerning specific boat. Refer to boat's inventory in case of doubt.

wiring.name: Optional Starboard to Port Crossover Conduit
Conduit from Panel to Foot of Mast

components.name: Seawater Foot Pump Intake / Cooler Drainage Seacock

specifications.route: along the gunwale to port handling winch

maintenance.method: Read and familiarise with the boat before casting off. Keep in a safe place and hand over to new owner if vessel is sold.
Contact BENETEAU dealer for maintenance, repairs, advice, spare parts.
Have boat maintained and serviced.
Hose down with freshwater. Regularly rinse deck and fittings with freshwater. Regularly brush deck with mild liquid detergent.
Consult dealer for appropriate methods and products. Apply epoxy paint (underbody) and antifouling paint. Degrease underbody and hand rub down with 400 grit wet and dry paper before antifouling.

maintenance.item: Anodes, electronic instrument transducers, raw water inlet strainers (especially engine cooling)
maintenance.method: Do not cover or obstruct.

maintenance.item: Deck fittings (blocks, sheaves, bottle-screws, winches, windlass, tracks, travellers)
maintenance.method: Lubricate with grease or light oil.
Polish with an appropriate product.
Scrub with water. Rub down with fine sandpaper to renovate aspect.
Rinse with freshwater. Clean with a sponge and a window-cleaning product.
Check.
Check correct tension.
Ensure it is accessible.
Air and ventilate. Remove soles, cushions, mattresses, and berth boards and place them vertically.
Protect with fitted curtains.
Make sure they are clean and dry.
Rinse with freshwater and a liquid detergent, then polish with a chamois leather.
Consult a specialist before any intervention for cleaning and maintenance.
Sterilise with Clanazone tablets (or similar products).

Check that it is operating correctly. Acquaint yourself with its operation (manual pump, electric bilge pump switch, cocks). Make sure strainer is not clogged. Regularly clean intake strainer in sump and system filter (electric bilge pump).

maintenance.interval: When leaving boat / After each use (toilets below waterline) / Before putting out to sea
maintenance.method: Close all seacocks when leaving the boat. Systematically close seacocks after each toilet use if below waterline. Make sure all seacocks not in use are closed before putting out to sea.
Consult a qualified marine electrician. Do not modify characteristics of surge protection devices. Never fit/replace equipment exceeding system amperage.
Securely lash down. Do not stow conductive objects close to terminals to prevent short circuits.

Do not work on a live system. Connect shore power cable to boat before connecting to shore supply outlet. Do not immerse plugs. Switch off shore power supply with circuit breaker on board before connecting/disconnecting. Do not modify connections. Only use compatible connections.
Do not fit/store flammable materials over stove. Never leave boat unattended when stove is working. Ventilate when in use. Do not obstruct ventilation apertures.

maintenance.item: Gas leaks / Cylinder change / Gas system work
maintenance.method: Do not smoke or use a naked flame. If gas smell or flame extinguished, close gas valves and ventilate. Look for cause. For stoves with integral cylinders, change cylinder outside boat, test before putting back. Ensure stove gimbals are secure.

Do not use cooking appliances to heat boat. Turn off stove knobs before opening supply valve. Turn off supply and cylinder valve when not in use. Do not obstruct access to components/valves. Change flexible hoses according to national legislation. Use safety-standard hoses. Do not use gas lockers for other equipment. Do not damage cylinder thread. Check regulator condition annually; change if necessary with identical one. Close and disconnect empty cylinder valves. Do not use ammonia-based solutions for cleaning/leak detection.

Do not smoke. Store fuel in reserved can away from heat sources. Follow manufacturer's recommendations for filling. Do not pour alcohol directly into burner over stove. Only use methylated spirits or denatured alcohol. Immediately wipe up spills.
Stop engine and do not smoke.
Make sure bilge is clean and dry. Do not start if fuel present. For petroleum engines, ventilate 5 minutes with fans to eliminate vapours.
Fill tank away from boat in well-ventilated place, far from ignition risks.

maintenance.item: Fuel not in boat tanks (outboard, jerrycans)
maintenance.method: Stow in a ventilated place.

maintenance.item: Engine compartment fire extinguishing system (fixed, petroleum engines)
maintenance.method: Locate aperture for extinguishing. Familiarise with discharge mechanism and operation. Ventilate compartment after discharging.

Do not discharge toilets close to shore. Inform yourself about local environmental protection regulations and codes of good practice. Respect international regulations against pollution of marine environment (Marpol).

Rinse system: fill bowl with fresh/sea water, then empty. Use domestic cleaning products. Empty system during immobilisation in negative temperatures. Do not discharge contents close to shore; use port/marina pumping systems before leaving port. Ensure discharge cock is closed to avoid inadvertent discharging.
